http://www.rollingstones.com/2013/06/30/glastonbury-festival-setlist-29th-june-2013/ Timeline Photos

The Rolling Stones have been announced to headline the Glastonbury festival on Saturday 29 June.

Mick, Keith, Charlie and Ronnie will continue their 50 & Counting celebrations on the legendary Pyramid Stage in what will undoubtedly be the highlight of this world famous summer music festival.

Mick tweeted: "Can't wait to play Glastonbury. I have my wellies and my yurt!"

Keith said: “We all had such a ball last year, and the energy between the band is so good. We can’t wait to play Glastonbury, see you on a summer's day in England!"

http://www.rollingstones.com/2013/03/27/the-rolling-stones-to-play-the-glastonbury-festival/

Comment below and share your memories of one of the greatest concerts of our career. Don't miss out on an extremely rare and intimate appearance from Charlie Watts in one of London's finest music venues. Charlie is joined by two of the world’s top exponents of the boogie woogie piano style, for a 2-pianos; 4-hands boogie wonderland extravaganza!

The ABC&D of Boogie Woogie featuring Axel Zwingenberger (piano), Ben Waters (piano), Charlie Watts (drums) & Dave Green (bass).
Expect the very best in blues and boogie-woogie (and perhaps a surprise or two) in one of the world's best jazz clubs!

Messages from Keith, Charlie and Ronnie on the postponement of the Australia/ New Zealand tour. 

Keith Richards:
“No-one saw this coming…Mick’s always been my soul brother and we love him…we’re thick as thieves and we’re all feeling for the man…we really hate to disappoint our fans but we’ll see everyone really soon.”

Charlie Watts:
"Needless to say we are all completely shocked but our first thought is to support Mick at this awful time. We intend to come back to Australia and New Zealand as soon as it proves possible.” 

Ronnie Wood:
"This is such terrible news and right now the important thing is that we are all pulling together to offer Mick our support and help him through this sad time. Without a doubt we intend to be back out on that stage as soon as we can."

Tomorrow is the 40th anniversary of The Brussels Affair concert.

Long hailed by die-hard Stones fans as one of the band's greatest live performances, The Brussels Affair has been a mainstay in the underground music world for years. The album is pulled from the two gigs that took place at the Forest National arena in Brussels, and was originally recorded by Andy Johns on the Rolling Stones Mobile Studio. Bob Clearmountain applied the final mix in 2011:

http://www.stonesarchive.com/bootleg_years/1973/

Photo by Claude Gassian, taken at the show Timeline Photos

Tonight the Rolling Stones finished the US leg of their ZIP CODE tour with a killer show at the Ralph Wilson Stadium in Buffalo, New York!

The band played a 19 song set to a sold out crowd of rapturous Buffalonians, including Sticky Fingers’ ‘Wild Horses’ and ‘Can’t You Hear Me Knocking’, ‘You Got Me Rocking’ (only the second performance of the tour) and ‘Out Of Control’.

The Rolling Stones are now heading to Quebec, where they will play the final show of their ZIP CODE tour at Le Festival d’été de Québec.

Tonight the Rolling Stones rocked Motor City! #StonesDetroit

The band played a killer 19 song set including a tribute to Motown records with their first performance this tour of the Temptations classic, ‘Just My Imagination’. The band also played Sticky Fingers gems ‘Moonlight Mile’ and ‘Bitch’.

The band are now heading to Buffalo, New York, for the final date of their American tour, and the penultimate North American show. Keep on rollin’!

Tonight the Rolling Stones rocked the Carter-Finley Stadium in Raleigh, North Carolina!

The band played a killer set under the full moon, with cosmic tunes including the very appropriate ‘Moonlight Mile’, ‘Shine A Light’ (which won the song vote)  and ‘Out Of Control’, along with much loved songs ‘Let’s Spend The Night Together’, ‘Midnight Rambler’ and ‘Miss You’,

Along with ‘Moonlight Mile’, the band also paid tribute to Sticky Fingers by playing ‘Bitch’ and ‘Brown Sugar’. All three songs are featured on the brand new album Sticky Fingers Live, recorded at the ZIP CODE opening night at the Fonda Theatre, Los Angeles, released yesterday exclusively on iTunes.

Buy Sticky Fingers Live on iTunes here: http://stickyfingers.lnk.to/livedownload

Thank you to Ed Sheeran our special guest in Kansas City tonight!

Tonight the Rolling Stones played a sensational show at Kansas City’s Arrowhead Stadium!

The band were joined by special guest Ed Sheeran, who performed their 1978 ballad ‘Beast Of Burden’ with them:

The Stones also played Wilbert Harrison’s song ‘Kansas City’ which the band used to play in their early blues sets, including during their very first gig at the Marquee Club in London, 12th July 1962.

The song vote winner, which won by just six votes, was ‘Street Fighting Man’.

The Rolling Stones are now heading to Raleigh, North Carolina, where they’ll play the Carter-Finley Stadium on Wednesday 1st July.

The Rolling Stones tonight played the final show of their tour of Australia and New Zealand, and the final show of their 14 ON FIRE tour.

Mick, Keith, Charlie and Ronnie played a 19 song set to a besotted crowd of 36,577 fans.

The winner of this Auckland’s hotly contested fan vote was Like A Rolling Stone, which one by a whisker of just over 500 votes. This was the third time the song won the fan song vote this year, having previously won in Madrid and, this tour’s opening night, in Adelaide.

The touring band at the Mount Smart Stadium, and every other show on this leg of the tour were, Lisa Fischer and Bernard Fowler on backing vocals, Tim Ries on sax and keys, Karl Denson on tenor saxophone, Darryl Jones on bass, Chuck Leavell on keys, and musical integrator Matt Clifford.

The Rolling Stones played 8 shows in Australia and New Zealand, travelled over 18,000 miles and 173,838 fans came to see them.

THANK YOU TO EVERYONE WHO CAME TO SEE US IN AUSTRALIA AND NEW ZEALAND, AND ALL AROUND THE WORLD THIS YEAR!

14 ON FIRE: BRISBANE

The final 14 ON FIRE show in Australia took place tonight at the Brisbane Entertainment Centre, where the Rolling Stones rocked the sold out crowd of 10,100 fans.

Fans were treated to a 19 song set which included online vote winner ‘Silver Train’, only the second time the song has been played since 1973! The rarity from the album Goats Head Soup garnered a staggering 45% of votes. Mick Taylor, who played on the original studio recording, joined the band for the song.

Check out the live blog from the show here.

The Rolling Stones are now heading to New Zealand, for last show of the tour, at Auckland’s Mount Smart Stadium.

Tonight the Rolling Stones lit the fuse of their 14 ON FIRE tour of Australia and New Zealand, with a sold out show at the Adelaide Oval.

The band played a 19 song set to a sold out crowd of 53,300 rocking fans. Mick, Keith, Charlie and Ronnie were joined by the 14 ON FIRE touring band of Chuck Leavell, Darryl Jones, Tim Ries, Karl Denson, Bernard Fowler, Lisa Fischer and Matt Clifford, and special guest Mick Taylor.

During the encore a man ran onto the stage, but the security guards tackle him and he was escorted off the premises. Mick quipped, “All part of the act, some Aussies Rules tackling!”

The band are now heading to the Perth Arena where they will play their next two shows.

Tonight the Rolling Stones returned to Zürich's Letzigrund Stadium where they rocked a 19-song set, to a sold out crowd of 50,000 fans.

The song request, made by fans in a tight online vote, was 'Let's Spend The Night Together'. The band also played rarities 'Worried About You', 'Out Of Control' and 'Can't Be Seen', which featured Keith on lead vocals.

The show was a triple celebration for the band, with Ronnie Wood celebrating his birthday, and 39 year anniversary since his first gig with the band (on 1st June 1975 at the LA Forum).

The band are now heading to Israel, where they play their first ever show in the country, at Tel Aviv's Hayarkon Park on Wednesday 4th June.

#StonesJapan
#ストーンズ来日 Timeline Photos

Tonight at the Tokyo Dome, the Rolling Stones played the song ‘Silver Train’ for the first time since Autumn 1973! The song was voted for by fans on RollingStones.com, the band’s official app, and their pages on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Google+, Instagram, Tumblr and Pinterest.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iOUetwr3h04

The vote was very close, so the band also included runner-up ‘You Got Me Rocking’ in their 19 song set.

Joining Mick, Keith, Charlie and Ronnie for ‘Silver Train’, was former Stone Mick Taylor, who played on the song the last time it was performed live, just weeks after the release of the album it’s featured on, Goats Head Soup.

The show marked the second sold out 14 ON FIRE concert at the Tokyo Dome. The band play their final night in Japan on Thursday at the Dome, which will be their 28th show at the venue.

For the full list of dates on the Asia-Australasia 14 ON FIRE tour go here.

The Rolling Stones returned to Hyde Park tonight, 44 years and 1 day since they played there in 1969. To a sold out crowd of 65,000 the band opened with 'Start Me Up', for the first time on the 50 & Counting tour.

The By Request winning song, as voted for by fans on the official Rolling Stones app and on RollingStones.com was'All Down The Line'.

The band were joined by Gary Clark Jr for 'Bitch', who had played earlier in the day.

Mick Taylor, who played his first gig with the Rolling Stones at Hyde Park 5th July 1969, joined the band for 'Midnight Rambler' and the final encore of '(I Can't Get No) Satisfaction'.

The Voce Choir and members of the London Youth Choir accompanied 'You Can't Always Get What You Want'.

The Rolling Stones tonight completed their final 50 & Counting North American tour to a sold out house at the Washington DC Verizon Center.

They were joined by the special guest of the tour Mick Taylor for 'Midnight Rambler', and the encore performance of '(I Can't Get No) Satisfaction'. Local choir, The Washington Chorus, accompanied 'You Can't Get What You Want'.

The Rolling Stones' next show is this Saturday 29th June, when they headline Glastonbury, the largest music festival in the world, attended by 175,000 people.

The Rolling Stones tonight played their second and final show at the Boston TD Garden Arena.

Special guest Mick Taylor joined the band for ‘Midnight Rambler’ and ‘(I Can’t Get No) Satisfaction’. The By Request song vote, as chosen by fans on RollingStones.com, was the seldom played ‘Memory Motel’ which features the lyrics:

“When I asked her where she headed for
‘Back up to Boston I’m singing in a bar’”

The next 50 & Counting show is at the Wells Fargo Center in Philadelphia on Tuesday June 18.

The Rolling Stones played their second night at the Los Angeles STAPLES Center tonight, and the final Californian show of the 50 & Counting tour.

For the first time this tour the band played ‘Faraway Eyes’, in honour of being close to Bakersfield, they also played ‘Sway’, voted for by fans at RollingStones.com, ‘Can’t You Hear Me Knocking’ and ‘Midnight Rambler’, where they were joined by Mick Taylor. The University of  Southern California Thornton Chamber Singers accompanied the band for their encore performance of ‘You Can’t Always Get What You Want’.

The band head north east later this week and will be playing the Toronto Air Canada Centre this Saturday, May 25.

The Rolling Stones rocked Las Vegas tonight, when they played the MGM Grand Garden Arena to a sold out crowd. The band were joined on stage by Katy Perry for the song ‘Beast Of Burden’, which was voted for by fans on RollingStones.com and in the band’s official app. The band were also joined on stage by Mick Taylor for ‘Midnight Rambler’ and ‘(I Can’t Get No) Satisfaction’ and by the Green Valley High Madrigal Singers for ‘You Can’t Always Get What You Want’.

The Rolling Stones are now heading to Anaheim, CA, where they will play two nights at the Honda Center, May 15 & 18, before returning to the Los Angeles STAPLES Center on May 20.

HP PAVILION, SAN JOSE: MAY 8 2013 SET LIST

Tonight the Rolling Stones played the HP Pavilion in San Jose, California. This was the band’s second show in the San Francisco Bay Area on this tour. The Stones were joined on stage by two legendary special guests, John Fogerty for the Womack and Womack song ‘It’s All Over Now’, and Bonnie Raitt for ‘Let It Bleed’. 'You Can’t Always Get What You Want’ was accompanied by the San Jose State University Choraliers, and Matt Clifford on French horn.

The band’s next show will be on Saturday May 11 at the MGM Grand Garden Arena.

THE ROLLING STONES AND ANDRETTI AUTOSPORT PARTNER TO FIELD STONES-THEMED CAR AT THE INDIANAPOLIS 500

On Sunday, May 24, when the green flag waves at the 99th Running of the Indianapolis 500 Mile Race, there will be another reason to say “Start Me Up!” This year’s Andretti Autosport No. 25 car will bring together two of the world’s best known names, The Rolling Stones and Andretti, as the car will be wrapped in a full front-to-back Rolling Stones ZIP CODE tour theme. On the same day that The Rolling Stones’ 15-city North American tour kicks off in San Diego, over 300,000 race fans at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway, and millions following the action on TV worldwide, will be captivated by the No. 25 entry driven by internationally accomplished British driver Justin Wilson.

“I’m really excited to have the Rolling Stones on the side on the No. 25,” said Indy 500 driver Wilson. “For the biggest race of the year, to have one of the biggest rock bands in history is just incredible. Listening to the Rolling Stones was a Sunday tradition in our house. We would wake up and my Dad would have the music on full blast. I’m really excited and cannot wait to unveil the car.”

After all the pulse-pounding, on-track, Verizon IndyCar Series action has ended, Stones fans will have the opportunity to catch the band when the ZIP CODE hits the Indianapolis Motor Speedway on July 4. Tickets and VIP packages are on sale now. For information please visit www.rollingstones.com/tickets.

AEG Live’s Concerts West is the promoter of The Rolling Stones ZIP CODE tour. The Rolling Stones’ Independence Day concert at Indianapolis Motor Speedway is promoted in conjunction with GLOBAL LIVE and is the first-ever non-race week concert at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway.

Did you come and see us on the tour? What are your favourite memories?

#STONESONFIRE

Links to purchase will only be posted on the 14 ON FIRE tour page here: http://www.rollingstones.com/tickets/ at 10am CEST on Wednesday 2nd, and Thursday 3rd April.

The Lucky Dip Tickets are restricted to a maximum of two (2) tickets per purchaser and must be purchased via www.rollingstones.com

Lucky Dip Tickets purchasers will not know the position of their tickets within the venue at time of purchase.  The position of the ticket within the venue will only be disclosed upon collection of tickets at the venue box office on show day.  Lucky Dip Tickets will be allocated across various ticket price categories in various positions within the venue, which may include restricted view seating or the back row of the venue. The purchaser acknowledges that there are no guarantees that Lucky Dip Tickets will be made available in all ticket price categories or in all areas of the venue.

By purchasing a Lucky Dip ticket, the purchaser accepts that the position of their ticket(s) within the venue is as allocated to them on show day and no correspondence will be entered into regarding the allocation of their ticket position within the venue.

Lucky Dip purchasers will be required to show ID which must match the name of credit card used to purchase the tickets at the box office when collecting their tickets and must have their guest with them.  Both the purchaser and their guest will be wrist banded at the time of collection and wrist bands must be worn at all times whilst in the venue. Lucky Dip Tickets are not transferrable. Persons that are not the purchaser and the purchaser’s guest may be refused admission.

The terms and conditions set out in these Lucky Dip Terms and Conditions apply to your purchase of  Lucky Dip Tickets, and are in addition to the Promoter and Ticketing Agency’s General Terms and Conditions of Purchase. If there is an inconsistency between the Lucky Dip Terms and Conditions and the General Terms and Conditions of Purchase, the provisions of the Lucky Dip Terms and Conditions set out herein will apply to the extent of the inconsistency. The Rolling Stones played a surprise gig at the Echoplex, Echo Park, Los Angeles, Saturday April 27 2013. Leading up to the opening of their 50 & Counting tour, which kicks of at STAPLES Center on Friday May 3. The tour debut will be followed by performances in Oakland, San Jose, Las Vegas, Anaheim, Toronto, Montreal, Chicago, Boston and Philadelphia.

http://www.rollingstones.com/tickets/

The band comprised of: Mick Jagger, Keith Richards, Charlie Watts and Ronnie Wood, with Mick Taylor, Darryl Jones, Chuck Leavell, Bernard Fowler, Lisa Fischer and Bobby Keys.

Rolling Stones fans offered 1000s of $85 tickets for US and Canada Tour

General onsale for tickets for the 50 & Counting tour of the USA and Canada commences at 10am local time Monday April 8.

As a part of the general onsale, there will be something for everyone, including over 1,000 tickets at $85 (including service charges). Some will be among the best seats in the house in the Tongue Pit, with others spread around the arena. Tickets will be sold as a pair. You will find out your seat location when you pick them up the night of the show. Other tickets range from $150- $600(plus service charges).

More details will be released on Monday, along with the links to purchase these tickets.
